sentences.en: An elephant's nose is extraordinarily long!
Apart from the hair, he looked extraordinarily unchanged.
sentences.cn: 令人惊奇的是，除了头发，他看起来一点儿都没变。

sentences.en: He had an extraordinarily penetrating gaze.
sentences.cn: 他的目光有股异乎寻常的洞察力.

sentences.en: He was diagnosed as severely dyslexic but extraordinarily bright.
sentences.cn: 他被诊断患有严重的阅读困难症，但是却绝顶聪明。

sentences.en: He wore an extraordinarily solemn expression.
sentences.cn: 他脸上带着异常严肃的表情.

sentences.en: I had a terrible head and was extraordinarily drunk.
sentences.cn: 我头很痛，已经酩酊大醉。

sentences.en: It has now become clear how extraordinarily fecund a decade was the 1890s.
sentences.cn: 现在已经很清楚19世纪90年代是多么超乎寻常、成就斐然的10年了。

sentences.en: It was extraordinarily embarrassing , and, after a while, horrible.
sentences.cn: 这样的反应真叫人难堪;久而久之, 简直叫人觉得可怕.

sentences.en: John was always so extraordinarily peaceable, one who invariably saw an opponent's point of view.
sentences.cn: 约翰总是非常温和，总是能够顾及反对者的意见。

sentences.en: She is an extraordinarily beautiful girl.
sentences.cn: 她是个美丽非凡的姑娘.

sentences.en: The parameters within which life can be sustained on Earth are extraordinarily narrow.
sentences.cn: 地球上生命可以存活下来的地域范围是非常狭小的。

sentences.en: The sea was extraordinarily calm that morning.
sentences.cn: 那天清晨,大海出奇地宁静.

sentences.en: The short dark hair was extraordinarily thick and soft.
sentences.cn: 短短的黑发,浓密极了,也柔软极了.

sentences.en: The sky was extraordinarily clear after the rain.
sentences.cn: 雨后初晴的天空分外明朗.

words.tran_cn: 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；临时的；特派的

trans.tran_cn: 很，十分，特别，极其，离奇地，出奇，倍加
